embeds.title: Class Default
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 (0) :e_automaton: / The Automaton

Next 2 times you create a Function, **Encode** a copy of the first card in it.

messages.content: its defnitely one of the powers ever
Do this on go-to and all of a sudden auto doesn't have that bad draw.
Do this with constructor and you can have very good block on a ton of functions.
do this on <d~cultist strike> for extra meta scaling

embeds.description: __**Cultist Strike**__: Deal 6 (9) damage. **Encode.** **Compile** - Increase this card's damage by 1 permanently.

messages.content: Do this with terminator if you ever want to not have fun with the game.
do this on <d~replicate> or <d~infinite loop> and uve just filled ur discard pile with junk

embeds.description: __**Replicate**__: Deal 5 (7) damage.   When Encoded, add a copy to your discard pile. **Encode.**
__**Infinite Loop**__: Deal 6 damage. **Encode.** **Compile** - Gain a copy of this and increase its damage by 2 (4).

messages.content: replicate replication is such a silly deck type that auto has
definitely one of my favorites
I've inadvertently did that in some act 1 fights with dupe pots. The extra dps can help a lot vs. nob.
wdym

oh wait thats it

the card
that exausts statues when drawn

Uncommon Power / 2 (1) :e_automaton: / The Automaton

When you draw the first **Status** or **Curse** card each turn, **Exhaust** it and draw a card.

messages.content: imagine how amazing robo chop would be with encode
I think if go-to was a common not a basic I think automaton would be so much stronger. Because imagine having multiple copies of go-to.
Class default makes that happen.
isnt there an event that copies cards?
There's other ways, but I found this to be the easiest, and it also means you can get functions out faster.
Yeah but it's somewhat rare, and I mostly see it act 1 and by then I might not have upgraded my go-to.
goto would probably be a rare if it were in the normal pool
Because I don't upgrade go-to at first campsite all the time.
i always recall first campsite

Only under these conditions will I upgrade it first: I don't have the gold (or want to spend the gold) to break red key, or if I am NOT 100% required to fight a floor 6 elite, here I will upgrade replicate.
Sometimes I recall first campsite in Downfall
Sometimes there's That One Card
like, identifying a Covet off of Snecko's starter unidentifieds
Goto is That One Card.
huh?
why would u want a covet in ur deck?
<covet>

embeds.description:
Basic Skill / 0 :e_hermit: / The Hermit

Discard 1 card.
Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
Discarded **Curse**s are **Exhaust**ed.

messages.content: for the same reason you want a <Prepared>?

embeds.title: Prepared
embeds.description:
Common Skill / 0 :e_green: / The Silent

Draw 1 (2) card (cards).
Discard 1 (2) card (cards).

messages.content: and also it does become a cantrip when upgraded
why would you want a prepared in ur deck as a non silent non hermit
well
you identified the covet
you do have access to hermit cards
isnt cover just a better prepared?
no
because u draw the cards second
wait
why does covet discard card first

Well:

- Multiple events give curses that Covet can deal with
- Covet is a sort of mulligan on a character that is _inherently_ living or dying by the dice
- Covet upgrades to Discard 1 Draw 2 which amplifies the mulligan effect
covet doesn't "deal with curses"
drawing the curse and covet costs 2 draws
then after uve played covet and exhausted the curse u have 1 extra card in ur hand
thats 4 cards
two draws that covet gives right back
thats the same as if u just drew the curse normally
but now the curse is gone
which can matter a lot
but the covet is still there
because it could be normality
and the covet STILL costs a draw
A draw
that it gives back
only after uve committed 2 campfires to that
at that point just pick up a <snecko ??? draw>

u dont need to identify the card
ALSO
u rarely need to identify anything unless its like adrenaline or wraith form
upgrade events exist and are good
its still taking the upgrade away from something else
oh yeah let me upgrade this <snecko strike>

embeds.title: Snek Bite

Basic Attack / 1 :e_snecko: / The Snecko

Deal 7 (9) damage.
**Muddle** the  (2 ) highest-cost card (cards) in your hand.

messages.content: Snek Bite is indeed one of the high priority upgrades
for much of the same reasons, it can reroll bad dice for you
but always having covet is _really_ good

even if there is just a single injury in the deck that still 

- refunds both draws when upgraded
- exhausts the injury so I don't draw it again, which is a net positive (only lose the draw once if unupgraded vs lose the draw every time I shuffle the deck)
on top of that, injury is not the only curse that exists
it only helps with curses while theyre in your deck
Dodging a Normality is 100% worth the lost draw
theyre still gonna get removed at the first chance u get
if I have access to Hermit cards? Hell no. only the really bad ones go
ayo this is a class default on automaton discussion, if you want to discuss hermit/snecko go to #strategy-and-deckbuilding
ANYWAYS
on to Class Default
it can do really funny things with <Boost> or <Fortify> or <Proto-Beam>/<Proto-Shield>

messages.content: but generally I find myself not using this card as I do not feel like I need it
Yeah it can be goofy and fun, mostly use it on cards that are hard to get (like rares or basics) or anything good but expensive or has good compile effects

Class default is a really nice tool to quickly build up functions, which is really valuable when first cycling through your deck, and extremely powerful once you reshuffle. In my experience, it almost doesn't matter what functions you build on automaton, any combination of three cards stapled together that only costs 1 energy and immediately goes to your hand after building it provides excellent frontloading and scaling all in one package. With that being said, of course not all functions are built completely equally, and this can make multiple copies of some very powerful functions if you can line it up properly. Full release can do some nutty things, repair can be used to get a lot of sustain, philosophize+, boost and fortify for scaling, iterate for high damage output, constructor blockchain and frontload can all really help with blocking, and goto to put more card draw in your deck. On top of all that, it has flexibility on it's side, you can use it in different ways depending on what you need for the current fight, making more scaling into giant head, or better block into nemesis for example. Probably one of the strongest synergy pieces with class default is runic pyramid, making it much easier to line it up with the card you want extra copies of, and letting you hold onto the functions you create if you don't have the energy to play them right away. Like many powers, it is a little bit slow, but it does help you catch up once you start building functions quickly with it. Overall, a really nice card that I think has a solid floor, and can have a very high ceiling with the right synergies.
